description: From Middle French [Term?], from Old French moderacion, from Latin moderātiō. Morphologically moderate +‎ -ion.

entries.meaning: The state or quality of being moderate; avoidance of extremes
examples: Mr. Chairman, at this moment I stand astonished at my own moderation!

entries.meaning: An instance of moderating: bringing something away from extremes, especially in a beneficial way
The process of moderating a discussion
examples: The moderation of a large online forum can be hard work.
